title: David Haye leaps to defence of KSI vs Logan Paul professional rematch

David Haye has defended KSI and Logan Paul as the pair prepare for their rematch as professional boxers.

The YouTube stars fought to a draw in Manchester last year and will bid to settle their rivalry in Los Angeles on November 9.

They have both been granted professional licences and will headline a card featuring world champion Billy Joe Saunders and rising star Devon Haney.

That means they will dispense with their headguards and pull on smaller 10oz gloves for the second installment.

(Image: PA)

The fight has come in for criticism after Eddie Hearn agreed to promote it.

But Haye told JD Sports : "Hopefully KSI wins again, he’s a good guy.

"These guys are multi-millionaires, they don’t have to do it. I think their ego is actually forcing them to go out there and do it.

"If it encourages a different demographic to tune in to a different pay-per-view event, then that helps the sport of boxing.

"It genuinely helps every other fighter on the undercard, they’re getting paid at pay-per-view, the show wouldn't be that without Logan Paul and KSI.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

"With KSI and Logan Paul fighting it just then puts more money in the pot for these other boxers, so I think it’s a good thing.

"Haney could fight on his own card in his own hometown, but with what television and ticket sales?

"He could do that and have his face as the main picture but he would get paid significantly less.

“He’ll probably fight on this card and get paid five times more than he normally would.

"Some people might tune in just to see the real boxers, the world-class boxers, but the majority probably won’t - they’ll be just tuning in to see KSI and Logan Paul and hopefully once they tune in to see that, they may see some world-class boxers."
description: KSI and Paul will clash for a second time on November 9 in Los Angeles in order to settle their rivalry
